intro: Chevaliera multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered chevaliera, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
